minidraw.framework
Interface Drawing

All Superinterfaces:
DrawingChangeListenerHandler, java.util.EventListener, FigureChangeListener, SelectionHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardDrawing
public interface Drawing
extends SelectionHandler, FigureChangeListener, DrawingChangeListenerHandler

The model component of the MVC pattern, a container of figures in MiniDraw. Responsibilities: A) Maintain the set of figures (add,remove) B) Maintain a selection of a subset of these C) Serve as Subject in observer pattern and notify DrawingListeners when changes to any figure happens. Much of the interface specification is copied literally from JHotDraw 5.1 however an effort has been made to repartition the interface into smaller interfaces: SelectionHandler, DrawingChangeListenerHandler. Author: Henrik Bærbak Christensen

Method Detail

add

Figure add(Figure figure)
Adds a figure and sets its container to refer to this drawing.

Returns:
the figure that was inserted.

Figure remove(Figure figure)
Removes a figure

Returns:
the figure to remove

iterator

java.util.Iterator<Figure> iterator()
Iterator over drawing's contents

findFigure

Figure findFigure(int x,
                  int y)
Find and return the figure covering position (x,y).

Parameters:
x - X coordinate
y - Y coordinate
Returns:
the figure at position (x,y) or null if there is not any there.

requestUpdate

void requestUpdate()
Request update: force a "repaint" event to all associated listeners on this drawing

lock

void lock()
Acquires the drawing lock. If you iterate over the Figures in a drawing while other threads are potentially adding or removing elements, you must scope the iteration by a lock/unlock pair.

unlock

void unlock()
Releases the drawing lock.
